Description:
Ensures that the personel safety maintaned within GCCIA premisses, through monitoring of equipment and perfoming audits and safety checks Summarized Attend and Investigate accidents to identify causes in order and determine how such accidents might be prevented in the future.
Prepare the safety inspection reports, accident investigation report, weekly safety reports (resolved & pending safety issues) and monthly reports.
Ensure fire suppression, firefighting and fire alarm systems are operational.
Ensure that all employees and visitors to sites and plants are briefed on risks, hazards and safety policies.
Ensure that monthly or quarterly inspection of all Fire Fighting systems, Fire Alarm system, Fire Extinguishers, Exit Lights and Emergency Lighting, are carried out.
Provide first line support on enquiries from employees and be available for technical support on site issues.
Perform Health Safety Environment & Security  audits on sites and GCCIA premises and carry out safety checks, on sites and plants.
Follow up on any deficiencies noted during inspections, and ensure that they are corrected.
Conduct risk assessment and enforce preventative measures.
Assist in eliminating incident injuries risk and minimize property damage and adverse environment impact.
Support the development of OHS (occupational health and safety) policies and programs.
Review existing policies and measures and update according to legislation.
Initiate and organize OHS training of employees and executives.
Stop any unsafe acts or processes that seem dangerous or unhealthy.
